messages: 7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (17:45): hm, i can boot netbsd on the mac without a bootloader but i need to enter openfirmware first, if i type boot there it boots it doesnt if i just let it autoboot

7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (17:46): sjamaan: but that is extremely bad for servers

b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:46): You can probably hack it to autoboot NetBSD

b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:47): LLcoolM: That bootmenu.4th runs straight from ofw
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:48): just put it on a HFS partition

b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:49): Hmm, I don't know
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:49): How did you put the bootloader on that partition?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:49): ofwboot.cxw
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (17:49): sjamaan: from linux
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (17:58): sjamaan: does the ofwboot.xfc disappear? once it is copied to that partition?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:58): ?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:58): how do you mean, disappear?
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (17:59): sjamaan: forget it (default ls cannot list hfs volumes=

b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (18:24): LLcoolM: Did you set boot-file to the bootmenu?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (18:25): Or was it boot-command?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (18:25): I can't remember
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (18:25): In any case, this is what I use, and I'm sure it works on my iBook
48a4fba2c4916bbc8aae694a3877dca3 (18:26): hmmm
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:28): Ouch.  vnconfig caused a panic (uvm_fault).  Guess I'm not supposed to try to mount an ISO image, then ;-|
48a4fba2c4916bbc8aae694a3877dca3 (18:29): u can mount it, but with vnd
48a4fba2c4916bbc8aae694a3877dca3 (18:30): http://wiki.netbsd.se/index.php/How_to_mount_Iso_Images_via_Loopback
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:31): milosn: did you read what I just said at all?
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:33): sjamaan: i set the boot-device
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:33): I know how I am supposed to mount ISO images, but I can't bloody create the vnode disk when vnconfig panics, now can I?
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:33): setting boot-command doesnt work at all
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:33): Perhaps it doesn't like the ISO being on an smbfs mount *shrugs*.
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:33): that only pops out the openfirmware console
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:34): Ouch, and so does the manual say ;-)
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (18:35): LLcoolM: Mebbe it was boot-file?
48a4fba2c4916bbc8aae694a3877dca3 (18:35): tp76: sorry ... half reading half not

c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:35): BUGS "the vnd driver does not work if the file does not reside in a local filesystem".  Though, an error saying "not local filesystem" or something would be nicer than a panic *shrugs*.

c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:40): Ah, better.  Now it works.  But really, would it be so difficult to have the vnd driver verify that the filesystem is local before going nuts and making the kernel panic?  A simple "error: file non-local.  See vnd(4)".
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (18:42): or just an un-explained error 45 :]
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:43): I'd prefer 42 in that case
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (18:43): "Protocol not available" makes no sense compared to "operation not supported"
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:44): jakllsch: no, not 42 as in errno(2).  42 as in THGTTG ;-)
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:45): sjamaan: well, thats enough, no more netbsd on mac
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:45): LLcoolM: you're giving up /already/? ;p
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:46): jakllsch: I'll remember to try this when 4.0 is released.  If it still panics, I guess I'll have to get my hands dirty ...
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:48): milosn: BTW, thanks for the Wiki URL.  Somehow the Wiki has completely escaped me.
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:49): tp76: now finally as i cannot have a server that cannot reboot without physical interaction
7c6b6c70bf698a62027f427e79d4c508 (18:49): but i am not going to throw that mac away, linux runs fine on it
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (18:50): Good bye.  It's been interesting ;-)

f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (19:10): sjamaan, then i have to choose to help the Valgrind development or send the PRs?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (19:10): No, you can do both
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (19:10): Maybe I misunderstood your question

b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (19:10): You can't use the send-pr form?
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (19:10): Send a mail to www@
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (19:10): ejk: just wanted you to know that it's working now after I added ioapic and apic to my kernel configuration and setting the MPACPI option.
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (19:10): I can use it, but the mail are not delivered
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (19:11): ejk: I believe you had the same problem (IIRC).
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (19:11): i think that the mail server lock the italian mails.

c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (19:14): ejk: this also corrected the "shutting down XMMS makes system unresponsive for X seconds" issue.  Things seem operate smoother in general now.  Oh well, now you know ;-)  Back to reading.

3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:39): Hi, another dhcp client neighter  dhclient nor pump?
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (19:42): s/-screensaver/-screenshot, obviously ;-)
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:43): to me?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:43): jokio: why?
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:45): I think that my ISP has problems if I use dhclient :(
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:47): sphex: do you known another tool to act as dhcp client?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:47): well.. yeah, maybe it would just magically work if you tried a lot of random other implementations...
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:47): or maybe not
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:47): personally, I'd just try to make dhclient work. since it's supposed to work. and appears to generally work. and stuff.
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:48): some people has the same problem, and using dhclient from windows work fine
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:48): so, the problem is in dhclient incompatibility
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:48): or PEBKAC
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:48): what is PEBKAC?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:48): sure, there's always a way to make something not work
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (19:48): jokio: see wtf(6)
75fedd09d0527e5fdfe478d57def6c19 (19:49): jokio: problem exists between keyboard and chair
75fedd09d0527e5fdfe478d57def6c19 (19:49): pitr said it in uf
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:49): funny people here
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:49): and there's udhcp in W.I.P. pkgsrc BTW, but I never tried it
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:49): does not complile :)
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:50): try to compile sphex, I see lots of errors
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (19:51): that's very possible in WIP
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:51): apart from dhclient, there is no others for netbsd??
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:52): dhclient is the closest thing you'll get to a reference implementation
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:52): ask your ISP what their problem is
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:53): my ISP tells me, ipconfig /renew_all and fix the problem ...
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:53): my way to fix it, is /etc/rc.d/dhclient restart
38188e7c72171f783daf07dd5fe58a50 (19:53): jokio: so your isp says you should renew the leases...
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:53): but is bad of course ...
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:54): yes, I think so tonio
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:54): one of you change nicks, my eyes hurt >,<
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:54): tonio: any solution?
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:55): anyway, the problem might be that they configured default-lease-time and max-lease-time to the same value
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:55): they should change this.
38188e7c72171f783daf07dd5fe58a50 (19:55): jokio: isn't that dhclient -r job ?
4eded2e2ccb0d854d6531d32be442eb5 (19:55): if that is the case
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:56): dhclient -r rtk0 for example? what is job?
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (19:57): tonio: tell me please :)
38188e7c72171f783daf07dd5fe58a50 (20:00): jokio: what you said. its supposed to renew the dhcp lease
38188e7c72171f783daf07dd5fe58a50 (20:00): (i really don't like dhclient's man page)
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (20:01): are you here?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (20:01): eh. I used to just delete its /var/db files for that. :p
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (20:02): I guess it's not really the same though...
38188e7c72171f783daf07dd5fe58a50 (20:02): you kan keep your happer, but that's not really the best solution
3f3f5436c5fc0d3d6b04030cbc0eef62 (20:02): okey, thanks
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (20:03): yeah I guess -r is the right way since it tells the server and stuff...
f6410c5ef2d71d5b4af0c47b45d1ac4f (20:10): hi
